cancel_n_clicks.description: Number of times the popup was canceled.

cancel_n_clicks_timestamp.description: Last time the cancel button was clicked.

submit_n_clicks.description: Number of times the submit button was clicked

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

displayed.description: Set to true to send the ConfirmDialog.

submit_n_clicks_timestamp.description: Last time the submit button was clicked.

message.description: Message to show in the popup.

src/components/ConfirmDialog.react.js.description:
ConfirmDialog is used to display the browser's native "confirm" modal,
with an optional message and two buttons ("OK" and "Cancel").
This ConfirmDialog can be used in conjunction with buttons when the user
is performing an action that should require an extra step of verification.

disabled.description: If true, the input is disabled and can't be clicked on.

selectionStart.description: The offset into the element's text content of the first selected character. If there's no selection, this value indicates the offset to the character following the current text input cursor position (that is, the position the next character typed would occupy).

selectionEnd.description: The offset into the element's text content of the last selected character. If there's no selection, this value indicates the offset to the character following the current text input cursor position (that is, the position the next character typed would occupy).

spellCheck.description: Setting the value of this attribute to true indicates that the element needs to have its spelling and grammar checked. The value default indicates that the element is to act according to a default behavior, possibly based on the parent element's own spellcheck value. The value false indicates that the element should not be checked.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

size.description: The initial size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of the type attribute is text or password, in which case it is an integer number of characters. Starting in, this attribute applies only when the type attribute is set to text, search, tel, url, email, or password, otherwise it is ignored. In addition, the size must be greater than zero. If you do not specify a size, a default value of 20 is used.' simply states "the user agent should ensure that at least that many characters are visible", but different characters can have different widths in certain fonts. In some browsers, a certain string with x characters will not be entirely visible even if size is defined to at least x.

className.description: The class of the input element

min.description: The minimum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

minlength.description: If the value of the type attribute is text, email, search, password, tel, or url, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters (in Unicode code points) that the user can enter. For other control types, it is ignored.

n_blur.description: Number of times the input lost focus.

pattern.description: A regular expression that the control's value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url, email, or password, otherwise it is ignored. The regular expression language is the same as JavaScript RegExp algorithm, with the 'u' parameter that makes it treat the pattern as a sequence of unicode code points. The pattern is not surrounded by forward slashes.

autofocus.description: The element should be automatically focused after the page loaded.

type.description: The type of control to render.

multiple.description: This Boolean attribute indicates whether the user can enter more than one value. This attribute applies when the type attribute is set to email or file, otherwise it is ignored.

max.description: The maximum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

n_blur_timestamp.description: Last time the input lost focus.

readOnly.description: This attribute indicates that the user cannot modify the value of the control. The value of the attribute is irrelevant. If you need read-write access to the input value, do not add the "readonly" attribute. It is ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, range, color, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type (such as button or submit).

selectionDirection.description: The direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if the selection was made from left-to-right in an LTR locale or right-to-left in an RTL locale, or "backward" if the selection was made in the opposite direction. On platforms on which it's possible this value isn't known, the value can be "none"; for example, on macOS, the default direction is "none", then as the user begins to modify the selection using the keyboard, this will change to reflect the direction in which the selection is expanding.

placeholder.description: A hint to the user of what can be entered in the control . The placeholder text must not contain carriage returns or line-feeds. Note: Do not use the placeholder attribute instead of a <label> element, their purposes are different. The <label> attribute describes the role of the form element (i.e. it indicates what kind of information is expected), and the placeholder attribute is a hint about the format that the content should take. There are cases in which the placeholder attribute is never displayed to the user, so the form must be understandable without it.

fireEvent.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the input changes.

n_submit.description: Number of times the `Enter` key was pressed while the input had focus.

name.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

debounce.description:
If true, changes to input will be sent back to the Dash server only on enter or when losing focus.
If it's false, it will sent the value back on every change.

required.description: This attribute specifies that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form. It cannot be used when the type attribute is hidden, image, or a button type (submit, reset, or button). The :optional and :required CSS pseudo-classes will be applied to the field as appropriate.

list.description:
Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user.
The value must be the id of a <datalist> element in the same document.
The browser displays only options that are valid values for this
input element.
This attribute is ignored when the type attribute's value is
hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

step.description: Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set. It can be the string any or a positive floating point number. If this attribute is not set to any, the control accepts only values at multiples of the step value greater than the minimum.

autocomplete.description: This attribute indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

maxlength.description: If the value of the type attribute is text, email, search, password, tel, or url, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters (in UTF-16 code units) that the user can enter. For other control types, it is ignored. It can exceed the value of the size attribute. If it is not specified, the user can enter an unlimited number of characters. Specifying a negative number results in the default behavior (i.e. the user can enter an unlimited number of characters). The constraint is evaluated only when the value of the attribute has been changed.

src/components/Input.react.js.description:
A basic HTML input control for entering text, numbers, or passwords.

Note that checkbox and radio types are supported through
the Checklist and RadioItems component. Dates, times, and file uploads
are also supported through separate components.

className_reject.description: HTML class name of the component if rejected

className_disabled.description: HTML class name of the component if disabled

accept.description:
Allow specific types of files.
See https://github.com/okonet/attr-accept for more information.
Keep in mind that mime type determination is not reliable across
platforms. CSV files, for example, are reported as text/plain
under macOS but as application/vnd.ms-excel under Windows.
In some cases there might not be a mime type set at all.
See: https://github.com/react-dropzone/react-dropzone/issues/276

id.description:
ID of the component. Used to identify component
in Dash callback functions.

className.description: HTML class name of the component

last_modified.description:
The last modified date of the file that was uploaded in unix time
(seconds since 1970).

style_active.description: CSS styles to apply while active

max_size.description: Maximum file size. If `-1`, then infinite

className_active.description: HTML class name of the component while active

filename.description:
The name of the file(s) that was(were) uploaded.
Note that this does not include the path of the file
(for security reasons).

disable_click.description: Disallow clicking on the component to open the file dialog

contents.description: The contents of the uploaded file as a binary string

logout_url.description: Url to submit a post logout request.

method.description: Http method to submit the logout form.

src/components/LogoutButton.react.js.description:
Logout button to submit a form post request to the `logout_url` prop.
Usage is intended for dash-deployment-server authentication.

DDS usage:

`dcc.LogoutButton(logout_url=os.getenv('DASH_LOGOUT_URL'))`

Custom usage:

- Implement a login mechanism.
- Create a flask route with a post method handler.
`@app.server.route('/logout', methods=['POST'])`
  - The logout route should perform what's necessary for the user to logout.
  - If you store the session in a cookie, clear the cookie:
  `rep = flask.Response(); rep.set_cookie('session', '', expires=0)`

- Create a logout button component and assign it the logout_url
`dcc.LogoutButton(logout_url='/logout')`

See https://dash.plot.ly/dash-core-components/logout_button
for more documentation and examples.

cancel_n_clicks.description: Number of times the popup was canceled.

cancel_n_clicks_timestamp.description: Last time the cancel button was clicked.

submit_n_clicks.description: Number of times the submit was clicked

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

submit_n_clicks_timestamp.description: Last time the submit button was clicked.

message.description: Message to show in the popup.

src/components/ConfirmDialogProvider.rea.description:
A wrapper component that will display a confirmation dialog
when its child component has been clicked on.

For example:
```
dcc.ConfirmDialogProvider(
    html.Button('click me', id='btn'),
    message='Danger - Are you sure you want to continue.'
    id='confirm')
```

refresh.description: Refresh the page when the location is updated?

src/components/Location.react.js.description:
Update and track the current window.location object through the window.history state.
Use in conjunction with the `dash_core_components.Link` component to make apps with multiple pages.

className.description: Appends a class to the Tab component.

style.description: Overrides the default (inline) styles for the Tab component.

disabled_className.description: Appends a class to the Tab component when it is disabled.

value.description: Value for determining which Tab is currently selected

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

disabled.description: Determines if tab is disabled or not - defaults to false

selected_className.description: Appends a class to the Tab component when it is selected.

selected_style.description: Overrides the default (inline) styles for the Tab component when it is selected.

disabled_style.description: Overrides the default (inline) styles when disabled

language.description: the language to highlight code in.

lineStyle.description: inline style to be passed to the span wrapping each line if wrapLines is true. Can be either an object or a function that recieves current line number as argument and returns style object.

codeTagProps.description: props that will be spread into the <code> tag that is the direct parent of the highlighted code elements. Useful for styling/assigning classNames.

useInlineStyles.description: if this prop is passed in as false, react syntax highlighter will not add style objects to elements, and will instead append classNames. You can then style the code block by using one of the CSS files provided by highlight.js.

lineNumberContainerStyle.description: the line numbers container default to appearing to the left with 10px of right padding. You can use this to override those styles.

lineNumberStyle.description: inline style to be passed to the span wrapping each number. Can be either an object or a function that recieves current line number as argument and returns style object.

startingLineNumber.description: if showLineNumbers is enabled the line numbering will start from here.

wrapLines.description: a boolean value that determines whether or not each line of code should be wrapped in a parent element. defaults to false, when false one can not take action on an element on the line level. You can see an example of what this enables here

showLineNumbers.description: if this is enabled line numbers will be shown next to the code block.

customStyle.description: prop that will be combined with the top level style on the pre tag, styles here will overwrite earlier styles.

src/components/SyntaxHighlighter.react.j.description: A component for pretty printing code.

initial_visible_month.description:
Specifies the month that is initially presented when the user
opens the calendar. Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

reopen_calendar_on_clear.description: If True, the calendar will automatically open when cleared

disabled.description: If True, no dates can be selected.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

updatemode.description:
Determines when the component should update
its value. If `bothdates`, then the DatePicker
will only trigger its value when the user has
finished picking both dates. If `singledate`, then
the DatePicker will update its value
as one date is picked.

number_of_months_shown.description: Number of calendar months that are shown when calendar is opened

min_date_allowed.description:
Specifies the lowest selectable date for the component.
Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

max_date_allowed.description:
Specifies the highest selectable date for the component.
Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

dashEvents.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

first_day_of_week.description:
Specifies what day is the first day of the week, values must be
from [0, ..., 6] with 0 denoting Sunday and 6 denoting Saturday

clearable.description:
Whether or not the dropdown is "clearable", that is, whether or
not a small "x" appears on the right of the dropdown that removes
the selected value.

display_format.description:
Specifies the format that the selected dates will be displayed
valid formats are variations of "MM YY DD". For example:
"MM YY DD" renders as '05 10 97' for May 10th 1997
"MMMM, YY" renders as 'May, 1997' for May 10th 1997
"M, D, YYYY" renders as '07, 10, 1997' for September 10th 1997
"MMMM" renders as 'May' for May 10 1997

start_date.description:
Specifies the starting date for the component.
Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

stay_open_on_select.description:
If True the calendar will not close when the user has selected a value
and will wait until the user clicks off the calendar

end_date.description:
Specifies the ending date for the component.
Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

month_format.description:
Specifies the format that the month will be displayed in the calendar,
valid formats are variations of "MM YY". For example:
"MM YY" renders as '05 97' for May 1997
"MMMM, YYYY" renders as 'May, 1997' for May 1997
"MMM, YY" renders as 'Sep, 97' for September 1997

is_RTL.description:
Determines whether the calendar and days operate
from left to right or from right to left

show_outside_days.description:
If True the calendar will display days that rollover into
the next month

calendar_orientation.description:
Orientation of calendar, either vertical or horizontal.
Valid options are 'vertical' or 'horizontal'.

with_full_screen_portal.description:
If True, calendar will open in a full screen overlay portal, will
take precedent over 'withPortal' if both are set to true,
not supported on vertical calendar

with_portal.description:
If True, calendar will open in a screen overlay portal,
not supported on vertical calendar

minimum_nights.description:
Specifies a minimum number of nights that must be selected between
the startDate and the endDate

day_size.description:
Size of rendered calendar days, higher number
means bigger day size and larger calendar overall

start_date_placeholder_text.description:
Text that will be displayed in the first input
box of the date picker when no date is selected. Default value is 'Start Date'

end_date_placeholder_text.description:
Text that will be displayed in the second input
box of the date picker when no date is selected. Default value is 'End Date'

src/components/DatePickerRange.react.js.description:
DatePickerRange is a tailor made component designed for selecting
timespan across multiple days off of a calendar.

The DatePicker integrates well with the Python datetime module with the
startDate and endDate being returned in a string format suitable for
creating datetime objects.

This component is based off of Airbnb's react-dates react component
which can be found here: https://github.com/airbnb/react-dates

labelClassName.description:
The class of the <label> that wraps the checkbox input
 and the option's label

inputClassName.description: The class of the <input> checkbox element

inputStyle.description: The style of the <input> checkbox element

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

labelStyle.description:
The style of the <label> that wraps the checkbox input
 and the option's label

disabled.name: bool
disabled.description: If true, this checkbox is disabled and can't be clicked on.

value.name: string
value.description:
The value of the checkbox. This value
corresponds to the items specified in the
`values` property.

fireEvent.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the checkbox item gets selected.

src/components/Checklist.react.js.description:
Checklist is a component that encapsulates several checkboxes.
The values and labels of the checklist is specified in the `options`
property and the checked items are specified with the `values` property.
Each checkbox is rendered as an input with a surrounding label.

initial_visible_month.description:
Specifies the month that is initially presented when the user
opens the calendar. Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

reopen_calendar_on_clear.description: If True, the calendar will automatically open when cleared

disabled.description: If True, no dates can be selected.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

number_of_months_shown.description: Number of calendar months that are shown when calendar is opened

min_date_allowed.description:
Specifies the lowest selectable date for the component.
Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

max_date_allowed.description:
Specifies the highest selectable date for the component.
Accepts datetime.datetime objects or strings
in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'

dashEvents.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

first_day_of_week.description:
Specifies what day is the first day of the week, values must be
from [0, ..., 6] with 0 denoting Sunday and 6 denoting Saturday

clearable.description:
Whether or not the dropdown is "clearable", that is, whether or
not a small "x" appears on the right of the dropdown that removes
the selected value.

display_format.description:
Specifies the format that the selected dates will be displayed
valid formats are variations of "MM YY DD". For example:
"MM YY DD" renders as '05 10 97' for May 10th 1997
"MMMM, YY" renders as 'May, 1997' for May 10th 1997
"M, D, YYYY" renders as '07, 10, 1997' for September 10th 1997
"MMMM" renders as 'May' for May 10 1997

stay_open_on_select.description:
If True the calendar will not close when the user has selected a value
and will wait until the user clicks off the calendar

month_format.description:
Specifies the format that the month will be displayed in the calendar,
valid formats are variations of "MM YY". For example:
"MM YY" renders as '05 97' for May 1997
"MMMM, YYYY" renders as 'May, 1997' for May 1997
"MMM, YY" renders as 'Sep, 97' for September 1997

is_RTL.description:
Determines whether the calendar and days operate
from left to right or from right to left

show_outside_days.description:
If True the calendar will display days that rollover into
the next month

calendar_orientation.description:
Orientation of calendar, either vertical or horizontal.
Valid options are 'vertical' or 'horizontal'.

date.description:
Specifies the starting date for the component, best practice is to pass
value via datetime object

with_full_screen_portal.description:
If True, calendar will open in a full screen overlay portal, will
take precedent over 'withPortal' if both are set to True,
not supported on vertical calendar

placeholder.description:
Text that will be displayed in the input
box of the date picker when no date is selected.
Default value is 'Start Date'

with_portal.description:
If True, calendar will open in a screen overlay portal,
not supported on vertical calendar

day_size.description:
Size of rendered calendar days, higher number
means bigger day size and larger calendar overall

src/components/DatePickerSingle.react.js.description:
DatePickerSingle is a tailor made component designed for selecting
a single day off of a calendar.

The DatePicker integrates well with the Python datetime module with the
startDate and endDate being returned in a string format suitable for
creating datetime objects.

This component is based off of Airbnb's react-dates react component
which can be found here: https://github.com/airbnb/react-dates

style.description: Generic style overrides on the plot div

animation_options.description:
Beta: Object containing animation settings.
Only applies if `animate` is `true`

setProps.description: Function that updates the state tree.

clear_on_unhover.description:
If True, `clear_on_unhover` will clear the `hoverData` property
when the user "unhovers" from a point.
If False, then the `hoverData` property will be equal to the
data from the last point that was hovered over.

relayoutData.description:
Data from latest relayout event which occurs
when the user zooms or pans on the plot

defaultValue.value:
{
    staticPlot: false,
    editable: false,
    edits: {
        annotationPosition: false,
        annotationTail: false,
        annotationText: false,
        axisTitleText: false,
        colorbarPosition: false,
        colorbarTitleText: false,
        legendPosition: false,
        legendText: false,
        shapePosition: false,
        titleText: false,
    },
    autosizable: false,
    queueLength: 0,
    fillFrame: false,
    frameMargins: 0,
    scrollZoom: false,
    doubleClick: 'reset+autosize',
    showTips: true,
    showAxisDragHandles: true,
    showAxisRangeEntryBoxes: true,
    showLink: false,
    sendData: true,
    linkText: 'Edit chart',
    showSources: false,
    displayModeBar: 'hover',
    modeBarButtonsToRemove: [],
    modeBarButtonsToAdd: [],
    modeBarButtons: false,
    displaylogo: true,
    plotGlPixelRatio: 2,
    topojsonURL: 'https://cdn.plot.ly/',
    mapboxAccessToken: null,
}

topojsonURL.name: string
topojsonURL.description: URL to topojson files used in geo charts

fillFrame.name: bool
fillFrame.description: if we DO autosize, do we fill the container or the screen?

displayModeBar.name: enum
displayModeBar.description: display the mode bar (true, false, or 'hover')

autosizable.name: bool
autosizable.description:
DO autosize once regardless of layout.autosize
(use default width or height values otherwise)

sendData.name: bool
sendData.description: if we show a link, does it contain data or just link to a plotly file?

queueLength.name: number
queueLength.description: set the length of the undo/redo queue

displaylogo.name: bool
displaylogo.description: add the plotly logo on the end of the mode bar

annotationPosition.name: bool
annotationPosition.description:
annotationPosition: the main anchor of the annotation, which is the
text (if no arrow) or the arrow (which drags the whole thing leaving
the arrow length & direction unchanged)

legendText.name: bool
legendText.description: edit the trace name fields from the legend

annotationTail.name: bool
annotationTail.description: just for annotations with arrows, change the length and direction of the arrow

showLink.name: bool
showLink.description: link to open this plot in plotly

modeBarButtons.name: any
modeBarButtons.description:
fully custom mode bar buttons as nested array,
where the outer arrays represents button groups, and
the inner arrays have buttons config objects or names of default buttons

scrollZoom.name: bool
scrollZoom.description: mousewheel or two-finger scroll zooms the plot

editable.name: bool
editable.description:
we can edit titles, move annotations, etc - sets all pieces of `edits`
unless a separate `edits` config item overrides individual parts

linkText.name: string
linkText.description: text appearing in the sendData link

staticPlot.name: bool
staticPlot.description: no interactivity, for export or image generation

showTips.name: bool
showTips.description: new users see some hints about interactivity

mapboxAccessToken.name: any
mapboxAccessToken.description:
Mapbox access token (required to plot mapbox trace types)
If using an Mapbox Atlas server, set this option to '',
so that plotly.js won't attempt to authenticate to the public Mapbox server.

frameMargins.name: number
frameMargins.description: if we DO autosize, set the frame margins in percents of plot size

plotGlPixelRatio.name: number
plotGlPixelRatio.description: increase the pixel ratio for Gl plot images

modeBarButtonsToRemove.name: array
modeBarButtonsToRemove.description:
remove mode bar button by name.
All modebar button names at https://github.com/plotly/plotly.js/blob/master/src/components/modebar/buttons.js
Common names include:
 - sendDataToCloud
- (2D): zoom2d, pan2d, select2d, lasso2d, zoomIn2d, zoomOut2d, autoScale2d, resetScale2d
- (Cartesian): hoverClosestCartesian, hoverCompareCartesian
- (3D): zoom3d, pan3d, orbitRotation, tableRotation, handleDrag3d, resetCameraDefault3d, resetCameraLastSave3d, hoverClosest3d
- (Geo): zoomInGeo, zoomOutGeo, resetGeo, hoverClosestGeo
- hoverClosestGl2d, hoverClosestPie, toggleHover, resetViews

modeBarButtonsToAdd.name: array
modeBarButtonsToAdd.description: add mode bar button using config objects

showAxisRangeEntryBoxes.name: bool
showAxisRangeEntryBoxes.description:
enable direct range entry at the pan/zoom drag points
(drag handles must be enabled above)

config.description:
Plotly.js config options.
See https://plot.ly/javascript/configuration-options/
for more info.

animate.description:
Beta: If true, animate between updates using
plotly.js's `animate` function

clickAnnotationData.description: Data from latest click annotation event

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

labelClassName.description:
The class of the <label> that wraps the radio input
 and the option's label

inputClassName.description: The class of the <input> radio element

inputStyle.description: The style of the <input> radio element

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

labelStyle.description:
The style of the <label> that wraps the radio input
 and the option's label

disabled.name: bool
disabled.description: If true, this radio item is disabled and can't be clicked on.

value.name: string
value.description:
The value of the radio item. This value
corresponds to the items specified in the
`values` property.

fireEvent.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the radio item gets selected.

src/components/RadioItems.react.js.description:
RadioItems is a component that encapsulates several radio item inputs.
The values and labels of the RadioItems is specified in the `options`
property and the seleced item is specified with the `value` property.
Each radio item is rendered as an input with a surrounding label.

modified_timestamp.description: The last time the storage was modified.

storage_type.description:
The type of the web storage.

memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

clear_data.description: Set to true to remove the data contained in `data_key`.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

data.description: The stored data for the id.

src/components/Store.react.js.description:
Easily keep data on the client side with this component.
The data is not inserted in the DOM.
Data can be in memory, localStorage or sessionStorage.
The data will be kept with the id as key.

max_intervals.description: Number of times the interval will be fired. If -1, then the interval has no limit (the default) and if 0 then the interval stops running.

interval.description:
This component will fire an event every `interval`
milliseconds with the event name `setInterval`

disabled.description:
If True, the interval will no longer trigger
an event.

n_intervals.description: Number of times the interval has passed

src/components/Interval.react.js.description:
A component that repeatedly fires an event ("interval")
with a fixed time delay between each event.
Interval is good for triggering a component on a recurring basis.
The time delay is set with the property "interval" in milliseconds.

className.description: Class name of the container element

containerProps.description:
An object containing custom element props to put on the container
element such as id or style

src/components/Markdown.react.js.description:
A component that renders Markdown text as specified by the
CommonMark spec.

disabled.description: If true, the option is disabled

multi.description: If true, the user can select multiple values

searchable.description: Whether to enable the searching feature or not

value.description:
The value of the input. If `multi` is false (the default)
then value is just a string that corresponds to the values
provided in the `options` property. If `multi` is true, then
multiple values can be selected at once, and `value` is an
array of items with values corresponding to those in the
`options` prop.

disabled.name: bool
disabled.description: If true, this dropdown is disabled and items can't be selected.

value.name: string
value.description:
The value of the dropdown. This value
corresponds to the items specified in the
`values` property.

clearable.description:
Whether or not the dropdown is "clearable", that is, whether or
not a small "x" appears on the right of the dropdown that removes
the selected value.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the input changes

placeholder.description: The grey, default text shown when no option is selected

src/components/Dropdown.react.js.description:
Dropdown is an interactive dropdown element for selecting one or more
items.
The values and labels of the dropdown items are specified in the `options`
property and the selected item(s) are specified with the `value` property.

Use a dropdown when you have many options (more than 5) or when you are
constrained for space. Otherwise, you can use RadioItems or a Checklist,
which have the benefit of showing the users all of the items at once.

count.description:
Determine how many ranges to render, and multiple handles
will be rendered (number + 1).

disabled.description: If true, the handles can't be moved.

updatemode.description:
Determines when the component should update
its value. If `mouseup`, then the slider
will only trigger its value when the user has
finished dragging the slider. If `drag`, then
the slider will update its value continuously
as it is being dragged.
Only use `drag` if your updates are fast.

vertical.description: If true, the slider will be vertical

min.description: Minimum allowed value of the slider

max.description: Maximum allowed value of the slider

step.description: Value by which increments or decrements are made

fireEvent.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the checkbox item gets selected.

className.description: Additional CSS class for the root DOM node

dots.description:
When the step value is greater than 1,
you can set the dots to true if you want to
render the slider with dots.

marks.description:
Marks on the slider.
The key determines the position,
and the value determines what will show.
If you want to set the style of a specific mark point,
the value should be an object which
contains style and label properties.

included.description:
If the value is true, it means a continuous
value is included. Otherwise, it is an independent value.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

pushable.description:
pushable could be set as true to allow pushing of
surrounding handles when moving an handle.
When set to a number, the number will be the
minimum ensured distance between handles.

allowCross.description: allowCross could be set as true to allow those handles to cross.

src/components/RangeSlider.react.js.description:
A double slider with two handles.
Used for specifying a range of numerical values.

contentEditable.description: Indicates whether the element's content is editable.

cols.description: Defines the number of columns in a textarea.

disabled.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the element.

wrap.description: Indicates whether the text should be wrapped.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

tabIndex.description: Overrides the browser's default tab order and follows the one specified instead.

draggable.description: Defines whether the element can be dragged.

style.description: Defines CSS styles which will override styles previously set.

rows.description: Defines the number of rows in a text area.

title.description: Text to be displayed in a tooltip when hovering over the element.

accessKey.description: Defines a keyboard shortcut to activate or add focus to the element.

hidden.description: Prevents rendering of given element, while keeping child elements, e.g. script elements, active.

spellCheck.description: Indicates whether spell checking is allowed for the element.

form.description: Indicates the form that is the owner of the element.

contextMenu.description: Defines the ID of a <menu> element which will serve as the element's context menu.

minLength.description: Defines the minimum number of characters allowed in the element.

readOnly.description: Indicates whether the element can be edited.

maxLength.description: Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in the element.

autoFocus.description: The element should be automatically focused after the page loaded.

placeholder.description: Provides a hint to the user of what can be entered in the field.

fireEvent.description: A callback for firing events to dash.

lang.description: Defines the language used in the element.

name.description: Name of the element. For example used by the server to identify the fields in form submits.

required.description: Indicates whether this element is required to fill out or not.

className.description: Often used with CSS to style elements with common properties.

dir.description: Defines the text direction. Allowed values are ltr (Left-To-Right) or rtl (Right-To-Left)

src/components/Textarea.react.js.description: A basic HTML textarea for entering multiline text.

style.description: Appends (inline) styles to the Tabs container holding the individual Tab components.

vertical.description: Renders the tabs vertically (on the side)

parent_style.description: Appends (inline) styles to the top-level parent container holding both the Tabs container and the content container.

parent_className.description: Appends a class to the top-level parent container holding both the Tabs container and the content container.

content_className.description: Appends a class to the Tab content container holding the children of the Tab that is selected.

mobile_breakpoint.description: Breakpoint at which tabs are rendered full width (can be 0 if you don't want full width tabs on mobile)

className.description: Appends a class to the Tabs container holding the individual Tab components.

value.description: The value of the currently selected Tab

content_style.description: Appends (inline) styles to the tab content container holding the children of the Tab that is selected.

id.description:
The ID of this component, used to identify dash components
in callbacks. The ID needs to be unique across all of the
components in an app.

src/components/Tabs.react.js.description:
A Dash component that lets you render pages with tabs - the Tabs component's children
can be dcc.Tab components, which can hold a label that will be displayed as a tab, and can in turn hold
children components that will be that tab's content.

dots.description:
When the step value is greater than 1,
you can set the dots to true if you want to
render the slider with dots.

disabled.description: If true, the handles can't be moved.

updatemode.description:
Determines when the component should update
its value. If `mouseup`, then the slider
will only trigger its value when the user has
finished dragging the slider. If `drag`, then
the slider will update its value continuously
as it is being dragged.
Only use `drag` if your updates are fast.

vertical.description: If true, the slider will be vertical

min.description: Minimum allowed value of the slider

max.description: Maximum allowed value of the slider

fireEvent.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the checkbox item gets selected.

className.description: Additional CSS class for the root DOM node

step.description: Value by which increments or decrements are made

marks.description:
Marks on the slider.
The key determines the position,
and the value determines what will show.
If you want to set the style of a specific mark point,
the value should be an object which
contains style and label properties.

included.description:
If the value is true, it means a continuous
value is included. Otherwise, it is an independent value.

setProps.description: Dash-assigned callback that gets fired when the value changes.

src/components/Slider.react.js.description: A slider component with a single handle.
